body.p: xsl:message instructions are one way to signal special situations encountered during transformation as well as a raw way of doing the debugging. This view is available only for XSLT debugging sessions and shows all xsl:message calls executed by the XSLT processor during transformation.

row.entry: Signals if processor terminates the transformation or not once it encounters the message (yes/no respectively)
Resource file where xsl:message instruction is defined and the message line number. The complete path of the resource is available as tooltip.

body.p:
The following actions are available in the contextual menu:
Go to - Highlight the XSL fragment that generated the message.
Copy - Copies to clipboard message details (system ID, severity info, description, start location, terminate state).
body.note:
Remarks
Clicking a record from the table highlights the xsl:message declaration line.
Message table values can be sorted by clicking the corresponding column header. Clicking the column header switches the sorting order between: ascending, descending, no sort.
